review: No joke, the Parker Red Robin is one of my go-to restaurants. We love the burgers and fries here (which are the same at any Red Robin), BUT the thing that keeps us coming back is the quality of service here.  Every time we go, we have a great experience with our servers. They magically appear out of nowhere to refill our drinks, offer us fries before our burgers arrive, and are generally upbeat all night. On a percentage basis, I've given some of the biggest tips I've ever given in life here. One of the many challenges of running a restaurant in the burbs is that there can be a LOT of kids that come through here. As a result, sometimes parts of the restaurant aren't as clean as you'd want or expect them to be. Usually, the team here will sit you in a cleaner area if some madness went down, but it kind of comes with the territory of burb life.  Fun fact: The veggie burger here is one of the better veg burgers that you'll have anywhere. They'll let you customize a burger to the point that it's almost unrecognizable, which is awesome.

I rarely give 1-Star rating. This experience, however, deserves the mark. We frequent and enjoy Red Robin. Their burgers are typically good and we love the fries. During this particular visit it all fell apart. First, I currently have some strict dietary restrictions. As it has it, RR has the Wedgie Burger which doesn't have gluten, egg, or dairy. Or at least it isn't suppose to have any of those things. So I ordered it and it came with a huge glob of mayonnaise. Instead of the server taking it back she argued with me that it is supposed to come with mayo. After much debate she gave me the, "fine, I'll go ask my manager" speech. She then came back 8 minutes later (my family was already done eating) and said, "I guess you were right, it isn't supposed to have mayo. What would you like me to do about it?" So that didn't make things feel very apologetic or accommodating. So I asked for a newly made Wedgie Burger. She went back and put the order in meanwhile my family was done eating. While I was waiting for the new Wedgie Burger to come to the table the same server spilled a tray of 8 drinks all over the people sitting at the table next to us. She basically freaked out and left the scene. She came back a couple minutes later with a handful of napkins and started helping to clean up people shirts, shoes, and the table. After a minor attempt to clean up she left. 12 minutes later my burger came with no acknowledgment of the mix up. Meanwhile, the family next to us got up and left the restaurant. When they left three employees and the manager moved the tables around while splashing through the 1/2 inch of soda, tea, and water on the ground. No one ever cleaned up the floor or put a sign out. People with their kids where slipping and sliding all over the floor trying to get to the bathroom and back. It was a total mess and a very UNSAFE situation. The restaurant wasn't even all that busy. It just came down to non-caring and inept staff and management. Honestly, they are lucky that no one fell or that I didn't break out into an allergic reaction. Overall it was a VERY stressful and unacceptable experience.

My family and I ate at this restaurant in early January.  Our credit card was charged twice. Upon realizing this, my husband called the restaurant and asked to speak to a manager and he was put on hold for thirty minutes. My husband called back a couple days later and spoke with a manager by the name of Steve. Steve said he would do some research and call back later that day. Steve called backed not the same day but two days later and told my husband there was no evidence of this double transaction. My husband printed off the statement from our credit card showing clearly that the card was charged the exact amount on the same day at the same time two times. He took this to the restaurant where he was told in a very condescending manner that there was nothing that could be done. Will not dine at this establishment ever again. I never write reviews but this was ridiculous.

I am leaving this review here because the last time I sent it to corporate it fell on deaf ears.  If you are considering this place over the one by Park Meadows, go with the one by Park Meadows.  This is the second time we have gone to this establishment and hoped that this time would be better then the last.  The place was still as dirty as before and the staff wasn't very helpful and hard to find when we needed assistance.  If there is one thing I remember from my time as a server years ago is, if you are going to talk bad about the customers do it when they have already left and aren't within ear shot.  There may have been a mix up in the kitchen and yes we may not have noticed until we had already started eating the food, but forgive me for not noticing a difference when no matter what you order it all tastes the same.  We only asked for 1 burger to be replaced and not all 3 like we should have since it was your kitchen that messed up, but when we asked for a replacement burger we were met with disdain.  Also my child did get sick and throw up on the floor and we apologized and let the wait staff know, and all the waitress do is come over with a rag and said "Here."  I am aware that it may have been my child that made the mess and yes we were wanting to clean it up, but don't come at us with attitude and then walk away because at the end of the day we don't work there and it is your job to clean up any messes regardless of who made them.

1 star is not a normal visit for us at this Red Robin but this visit was so so bad. Pamala was our server only by title not by action.  The Manager did end up coming over to try and make things "right" but at that point, damage was already done. While speaking with the manager, Pamela interrupted us to put in her two-cents. The manager had to ask her to stop.  This Red Robin has become our stand-by if we don't know what to do for dinner or spur of the moment want to go out. That most certainly will change due the the audacity of this "server".  With that said, James who is a server we have had several times, recognized us and came over to greet us.

The food was made wrong. I sent it back and it came back in record time with no changes to the food. The chicken teriyaki should have teriyaki on it and smothered in it. Mine only had an excessive amount of mayonnaise. It's not chicken mayo sandwich.  This is there signature sandwich. The cook said they had new staff which is not a good excuse. I will not come back. The service got worse as they tried to ignore us. It's very disappointing because I eat that sandwich every time I go.

I have always been a big fan of Red Robin and this is the one I usually go to, but I have been going less and less due to the unsatisfactory food. This recent time it was an okay meal but the service is scaring me away from this location.  My reason for dropping them from 4 stars to 3 stars comes from our experience the other night. It was my dads birthday, the waiter was friendly when he got us drinks but then failed to come back to our table for 15 minutes to get our orders. When he came back I don't know what happened but he was in a real pissy mood. I pointed to the back of the menu and asked for the grilled chicken and he replied snotty what sandwich . I said there wasn't a sandwich name it just said grilled chicken sandwich  and I wanted it protein style. He didn't even know the menu. He was also rude to my dad when asking what cook he wanted on the burger. Never brought us fries or anything the manager however came by and brought us fries. It only went down hill from there when the food runner brought our food and asked if we were missing anything and clearly my dads food was not there. It took another 5 minutes to find someone to ask. We asked the manager and he went to find his food . The service was terrible , I don't even want to go back to the location purely because of just service.

Impressed with the waiters at this location, they were so much fun and clearly enjoyed their job. From someone recently on the MSPI diet for my breastfeeding daughter, the allergy app was incredibly helpful.

The service here is always good and the food is never that bad, but the manager is the least professional manager I have ever seen at a chain restaurant.  I didn't want free food, dint have any complaints, just needed a table that didn't share the booth bench with another table that's literally it.  It was 4pm so it wasn't busy (which is when we always eat since we understand during the dinner rush seating may be limited) and the manager refused to allow us to sit in any other seating area.  This has never been a problem and the host is always able to take care of us but the person that is supposed to be running the restaurant won't? My wife is the friendliest person on earth and was polite to him but he wouldnt budge, so I walked up and said we will go elsewhere, he said that sounds good.  We will never come back and I will send a more detailed message to their corporate office.
Love love love the French fries. Burgers and good too. We have eaten here over a few years now. Never had a bad dining experience here.
Nice place but your food is not as good as it used to be. Over cooked. Kids do not like their food over cooked.

It's Red Robin.. you know what to expect when it comes to the food. As always it was great and as expected. On top of that, the service was incredible! We'll be back soon as Red Robin is a favorite with our kids.

Love the staff! The manager rocks and they totally let us play board games at the table for family game night. The food is up to Red Robin standard and I feel super comfortable with my family there. A trusting environment!

While our food was okay (room temperature) our server wasn't close to being on her game tonight. It's always hit or miss with the staff here and tonight was a miss. Had to repeatedly ask for the same several things over and over and remind her that we'd asked for other things, it became frustrating right away. The place was extremely loud which it usually tends to be. It was a mediocre experience at best.

Great service, good food, but just not worth the money. With tip, we paid $85 for our family of seven. We can eat at Chilis for about $60 and get more than burgers. And, I thought the burgers were pretty small portions. I just don't think the money is worth what you get at RR...

Sat in the bar and was waiting to order. Guy who came in after me was helped first. Waitress was horrible. She stopped by and brought the wrong refill only to tell me somebody else would be waiting on me because it had been a long day as she held a cigarette and lighter in her hand, very tacky! Oh, and my bun on the burger was stale. :(

Red Robin Managers  This is the second time that I've ordered a takeout from your restaurant in Parker, Colorado and the first time it was a fiasco I couldn't get anyone to answer the phone and it was not prepared on time and I got it home and it was cold etc. So, second time I went in and nobody was at the bar and there 2 girls in waiting area waiting to be seated /and I stood there for about five minutes waiting for somebody to see me -finally the two girls that were sitting there that I thought were guests were employees. They were giggling. On their phones and gossiping  finally dude bartender came out was completely cool got me extra sauce and made sure order was right. This was all at peak lunch hour times. If I was manager here. I'd want to know. The Cobb salad with chicken was dry and the chicken tasted like it was from Costco. I'm a Yelper so rather than doing a poor review I'm letting you know through this email. Update. I waited on line 14 minutes to voice complaint. Finally hung up and there is no direct click email I could find to send email to manager. Piss poor altogether  Poor experience. Such a bummer.

This is by far the friendliest RR we have been to!  We moved to this area 2 months ago and always sit at the bar or in the bar area. We have probably been here 20 times and although having a different server or bartender every time, each of them treat us amazingly!!  Others are good. This one is GREAT!

We frequent this particular Red Robin fairly often, as we have 4 children, and we are always impressed with the food and service.  The last time we visited on 6/14/17 we were celebrating my daughter's 7th birthday and we had an exceptional experience with Tammy as our server.  She was extremely attentive, one of the best servers we have had anywhere in quite some time!  Our order, although very large and detailed (as we had other family members there celebrating with us), came out perfectly and was delicious!  We greatly enjoyed our visit here and when we go back, will be requesting Tammy!

For 2017 working to review 119 dining places in Parker Colorado, 18 of 120. A reliable burger chain with a "wide variety" of burgers if you don't like what's on the menu, you can customize it to your heart's delight. It's encouraged, unlike other places that judge you or flat out refuse to allow substitutions or your own creations. The "bottomless" (God Bless America!) steak fries are okay but can be inconsistent one batch is fine and the next batch is overdone. I believe a lot of this is due to the fry change they made some years back, they have never been the same. Any way if you can't wait for your food they will bring a basket for you to munch on while your entrees are being prepared. Our burgers came out hot and delicious. The best thing these days at Red Robin is the bar area is 21 and over.  We stopped coming for many years after our kids got older now empty nesters... I love little kids as long as they are someone else's.  Eating in the bar brought me back to RR.  The bar pours a good drink a little on the high side for price.

What's happened to Red Robin? We live near by and have gone here for years and enjoyed it. We went last night and the service was great, friendly and attentive, but the food quality has dropped off.  It feels like they are trying to cut costs and in doing so the quality, flavor and overall experience has suffered.  My son ordered the curly spaghetti and it came out as a warmed up square block of noodles with some sauce on top. He did not like it. My other son's burger was bland. The bun on my burger was cheap and the iceberg lettuce was dry and stale.  My kids and I were disappointed and want the old Red Robin food back.

This place SUCKED A$$ tonight!! We went here for my 12 yr olds birthday. WTH has happened to RR??!!! We ordered and waaaiiited for 20 min for our appetizer then another 20 min for our food. Once the food came out my burger was cold. I sent it back and got a new one within minutes. However, that sucker fell apart right before my eyes! Bun, sides etc all over the place. My son had to ask if was going to get his birthday song.., good grief! My wife and I were laughing because we were wondering if they offered overnight sleeping accommodations since it takes a day to get your food. Well $65 bucks later and I couldn't get outta there quicker. See ya RR, next time it's Freddy's with no need to tip

I'm leery to write this review, but I'm putting it out there in case anyone has had a similar experience. Ate here on Thursday night before Christmas, and that night I was the sickest I've ever been. Could have been stomach flu, but I'm sadly leaning towards food poisoning. I was the only one in my family of 4 to order chicken, and the only to get sick. After a grueling 14 hours, I was basically better aside from getting my strength back. My family eats here a lot, and I would say they are consistently 4 stars, with consistent food and pretty good service, with occasional misses with the service. Rarely has there been a major food issue and they are always willing to correct it. I certainly hope I'm wrong in this instance, but wanted to see if anyone had a similar experience.

Haven't been Parker restaurant  in a year, now remember why. I had a grilled 'Insane Romaine,' and the leaves were soggy and old. I've had this before, at a different RR, and this was bad. My husband wanted a 2nd helping of 'bottomless fries' and waited and waited and our server never came back. 10% tip. We are really good tippers and have friends in the business, the table app/kiosk  makes wait staff lazy. Won't be back.

We came here on Mother's Day evening when all the other restaurants in town were booked. I really wanted sushi, but I was not willing to wait until 8 PM to eat with my two little children.  There was a wait at the door, which was to be expected, but it was not a long wait. We were sat next to an area that holds chalkboards for your entertainment. I enjoyed this, because my two-year-old and I were able to play and color on the chalkboard while we waited for our food. This way I did not have to hand over my phone to keep him entertained.  The server that we had, I wish I could remember his name, was awesome. He was very attentive and very quick with our order. He was also very patient with our little children making a mess and my requests for our kids to keep them happy. I appreciate his ability to stay on top of his tables because I know he was busy!  Our food was delicious and reasonably priced. We have been noticing that a lot of places that we visit here in town are a little pricey, but that's just the area. We will continue to visit this red Robin in the future and continue to send our friends and family.

Once again another error in the to go order.  Tried calling the location but unable to get anyone to pick​up.  You now have to deal with this centralized calling center and press option 3 to speak with someone at the location but every time you press option 3 the message just repeats.  Now I have to drive 30 minutes to get my refund for the missing order. Terrible service and beyond frustrating.

location: Buckley Air Force Base, Aurora, CO
review: We love coming here. Family friendly atmosphere, good prices and good food. Love the bottomless chips and salsa! Great spot!

Red Robin isn't a place I seek out (their beef has always made an impression on me -- it seems like it's such low quality) and now that I'm a low carb eater, their bottomless steak fries would seem more like a curse than a gift from the heavens. When I was visiting relatives in Parker, they wanted to hit the bar and grab some food. This is how I found myself at a Red Robin for the first time in 8 years. Remembering how the meat used to make me gag, I opted for a grilled chicken sandwich. Imagine my delight when the kitchen had no problems wrapping it in lettuce instead of a bun and then they offered -- here's the kicker -- a side salad, cole slaw or fresh broccoli instead of fries....and ALL WERE UNLIMITED! Yes! All you can eat salad, cole slaw or broccoli if you don't want french fries! I'm in love!  The food was just "meh." Acceptable but nothing to write home about. I still think it's overpriced and the prices aren't in line with the quality of ingredients. BUT, they truly understand low carb living here so, while I don't think the food is anything special, I will add Red Robin to my chain restaurant rotation.

Your normal Red Robin... good food, good service, overpriced beer and burgers. What makes it a 2 star review is the table next to us was allowed to have their dog with them. I understand the need for service or emotional support dogs, but the line is crossed when the dog is in the booth and on the the table and not well behaved. Makes me wonder what sat in the booth and drooled on the table before I took my kids there.

Friday 11/18 @ 7:00pm ... My niece chose this restaurant for her 8th birthday dinner. We had a 45-60 minute wait to be seated, but it is Friday evening, so that was expected. We were pleasantly surprised when we were seated within 30 minutes. We ordered drinks and food. They came in a reasonable time frame and tasted great. My sister was missing bread with her salad so she asked our server for it. It never came. My niece and nephew asked for more macaroni & cheese to share (free refills). It never came. Our server thanked us at the end of the night and forgot about my nieces birthday. He FORGOT. She was disappointed, but said, "It's ok. I didn't really want them to sing anyway." No, sweet girl, it's not ok. It's unacceptable. A manager was walking through and asked how everything was. My sister mentioned to him about my niece's birthday. He apologized profusely and gathered a group of employees to sing. She was SO happy and thoroughly enjoyed the ice cream sundae. We were grateful to the manager for correcting one, and by far the most important, mistake our server made this evening.

For some reason, I have a love hate affair with this red robin and continue to go back even though the service is continually sub par.  They're slow, no other way around it.  With the table side checkout boxes, you'd think they'd be able to speed up the other parts of service but frankly, it seems worse than ever. Food was good once we got it, I always go with a variety of lettuce wrapped chicken burger, this go around was the bruschetta which tasted fine.  Wife had a wrap and my daughter with some kids menu item, grilled cheese I believe. They do keep their drinks full which is nice, maybe I'm just disappointed in the kitchens effort to get things out, restaurant wasn't busy by any means so a 10-15 minute turnaround time should be achievable. I'll go back, it's inevitable, just wish they'd look at their cooking process a little more surgically.

I love Red Robin. Love love love. However, today my experience was terrible. I've been to this Red Robin many times before over the years, and I've only had a few bad experiences, mostly positive.  We came in today around 3 PM and we had to wait like 5 minutes to be seated. As then it took a while to take our order. And then the food took forever to come out, etc. There weren't even that many people in the restaurant. They really needed some more staff. I ordered the Avo-Cobb-O Salad as I usually do.  Today I had one of the biggest shocks ever. The salad came out on a square plate, a quarter the size it used to be. The portion was ridiculously small. I was honestly so surprised. The price was the same, the salad was very small. I loved red robin because of the fact that the salads were bigger portions. It's extremely disappointing when one of your favorite restaurants makes a menu change that only benefits the company. I asked the waitress and she said it was something cooperate.  I don't really know how to feel about Red Robin anymore. I came in last week and I had the full portion salad, and now it's gone. Just like that.  The food quality is amazing, but I can't believe Red Robin is trying to skimp out on their salads. I don't want to see one of my favorite restaurants to go way down in quality.
Spotty service, incorrect order delivered, and then over charged.  This used to be a good location but has not been impressive lately. Has management changed?

Enjoyed our family dining experience on national hamburger day! Their burgers are quite delicious. Service was amaing, which I was super pleased about since the last two visits were mediocre. We ordered towering onion rings to start, and they too were amazing. Wish I had the appetite for dessert, as their new menu options looked amazing. Overall, I really like what RR has done with their menu options and dining room experience. Adding the little machines to pay when you're ready was also a great idea. The only downfall, the prices. For our family of four $62 for cheeseburgers, including one which was a kid size, is a lot of cha-ching. We eat at Chilis for $40.

Bottomless steak fries! I always get the whiskey bbq chicken wrap, which probably isn't very calorie conscious, but the flavor really makes it worth it. Red Robin is one of the only quick places where you can get a mint milk shake; Sonic doesn't even have mint! What is that? Anyway, Red Robin has been a perfectly fine place for after church lunch with friends. It can get a bit boisterous inside, but the servers are friendly and attentive. I've come in a couple of times for dinner when service is slower, but that has never happened at lunch before.

I can't put my finger on it, but I am just not a Red Robin fan.  I don't dislike the place, I just always leave feeling kinda meh.   This one in Parker is always packed to the gills with families.  I think  30 people where working tables today, so I would have expected much better service than we got.  We sat forever before we got asked for drinks (by a waiter who took pity on us, not even our waitress), forever to get food, and so on.  It was packed, but the tables around us seemed to be getting served just fine.   At any rate the food is what it is.  They either have way too may ingredients on a burger (and they all have mayo - yuck). Or they are so bland plain they are boring (I had a blacked chicken sandwich that has a few shakes of blackening on it).   It pleases the step son and is great for families, but it isn't a place we go unless we have kids with us.  It just lacks.  Service is slow.  Food is boring.  Prices are fine.

They remodeled this location and it's geared more to adults now. The food is ok but my favorite is the bottomless basket of fries. Please put more than 8 fries in that basket though. We also like the freckled lemonade which has pieces of strawberry in it. A quick and not too expensive restaurant.
typically Red Robin is a kid burger place. Balloons for all ages.  Tonight service was slow and they forgot about or food. lol. the meal was comped. So thats good. Normally, a fun time for the kids.

I've really missed Red Robin while living in Brentwood, TN. There wasn't a location anywhere near us. I ate at the Parker, CO location last week and my chicken sandwich was good, but what has happened to the steak fries? They used to be about an inch wide, thick, and very good! Now it seems they are using a cheaper product and many of the fries were from the edge of the potato. They aren't any good anymore and in my opinion, that's what set them apart from other burger joints.  I think, if they're looking to cut cost, ditch the bottomless fries and return to the product that they used in the past!! I'd rather have a smaller amount of a top-notch product than an unlimited amount of an inferior product. Probably won't return unless they change the fries!

I do not like the seasoning on the fries at all since it changed, I used to like the garlic Parmesan fries. The fish and chips leaves much to be desired and is usually brown or black on the inside and not completely cooked, kind of mushy. I think the barbecue chicken wrap is my favorite, and the onion rings are pretty good. When It gets busy, you get ignored, and a lot of mistakes are made, but with the right number of guests, the staff is on point. I get there about 6 to 8 times per year. Love the new remodel.   Thanks Red Robin Parker for an over all great job

ok, it's a chain, so your'e going to get pretty much the same thing at any other R.R. However, the service here was wonderful, fast and the lunch crowd wasn't a bunch of hopped up, sugar loaded kids screaming in your ears. Glad we can get a great burger and avoid that.

This is the best place for kids. We go here when our 4 year old isn't in the best of moods because they make awesome ice cream sundaes (just ice cream and sprinkles if that's the way you want them, and it is) and they have balloons - balloons and ice cream! You can not beat that. :)  The service is good at this Red Robin too. We always get fast and polite service here, the staff is very friendly to our kid and the food is good. I've never had a bad experience here. Oh, and they have other good menu items other than burgers - the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad is delicious.

I love Red Robin and especially the one in Parker as they are a flagship.  Being a flagship means that we get items on our menu before other stores. The bad news is that you grow to love something and then bam it might not do so well and it is taken on the menu or you go to a different Red Robin and it isn't on the menu. Some of their new burgers are hit and miss but when they offer then for $6.99 it is always worth trying.
Burger was absolutely freezing cold in the middle and this has got to be the 49th time this has happened. But the order of fried mushrooms were delish!!

I love this location because it is a test location (along with Castle Rock, Havana, and Park Meadows). They different items from Castle Rock (which is where I live) so it is nice to try new things from time to time.  I also really enjoy the GM of this location. It is so important to have a great leader "running the ship". I have never had a bad experience here.  Also, I guess I come in the majority of the time during the lunch shift, because I have never experienced the noisiness and kid commotion, as described by other reviews. It has always been one of the quieter locations in my experiences.

I haven't been to a Red Robin in at least 10 years, but we tried it last week. We ate the spinach artichoke dip, it didn't taste bad but it came with four sickly pieces of celery and a very small pile of tortilla chips. Not worth $7. My jalapeño burger was decent and so were the sweet potato fries. My husband also ordered a burger, I don't remember which one, that wasn't too impressive in his opinion. After eating at a real burger joint like 80\20 burger bar in Virginia Beach... Maybe no other burger will compare.
Food is excellent!  There can be a high noise level though which is the only drawback. The service is excellent as well.

Red Robin is great and one of my favorite chains.  This location doesn't disappoint.  Very family friendly and servers seem happy.  My husband goes for the burger while I opt for a wrap.  Hot fries are the best and I splurge when I am here and dip them in ranch...yum.

what can I say...it's a chain, with cold calculated atmosphere. But the burgers, jesus. There is nothing better than a royal with fried egg when I am craving a burger.  add great  fries and ranch dressing for dipping, and it is an artery clogging dip in the calorie pool. Can't do it often, but never disappointed when I do.
Very good service.  The bartender and his boss were having fun doing their job.  The food was served up fast and hot and the beer was cold so what more could you ask for.
Im always a fan of Red Robin!!!! we moved here 2 months ago from CA and are very happy we can continue eating at my favorite family restuarant!! Love the Parker location!!

Just got home from dining at the "new and improved" Red Robin in Parker. NOT impressed! The dining room looks as if they were going for some garish cat house looking theme with bright red chairs and black tables. If you want to see the cool pictures they had hanging you now have to look on the ceiling. The family atmosphere when you walked in the door is now a look of a not well decorated pub. The family part is completely gone. My husband and one of my granddaughters felt sick after eating their food. I felt sick by the completely mismatched themes and the family restaurant gone wild appearances. The first table we were seated at wobbled so badly my granddaughter almost fell. The service was ghastly! It took almost 30 minutes to even get our drinks. We used to go there quite frequently but we will not be going back. Thumbs down on this one!

Completely delicious and I gained 20 pounds during my first and only trip. I can't quite see going back, but only because the potential for choosing something even remotely not horrible for you on the menu is next to nil.

Great food but sometimes lacking in service. It gets very busy and sometimes were forgotten about for long periods of time. The bottomless fries are great for the kids especially with red robins poppyseed honeymustard!

If you have a truck load of screaming children and don't mind hearing "Happy Birthday TO YOU" at least 5 times, this is the place for you. Average price for okay food. Never a very long wait, even when it seems real busy. My appetizer always seems to come out AFTER my food. Hmmm... Well anyways if you plan on making a trip to any RR, be sure and check the entree customizer on their site before heading over! Some of the options on the menu are a deceivingly horrible for you... but there are always modifications that can be made to make the food not AS bad for you!
Great burgers, great onion rings and fries, great service.  It's a good place to go for a nice dinner away from home.  Definitely recommended especially if you don't have $50 to spend.

I love this place.  I am never disappointed.  My oldest son calls it the balloon factory since he always gets a balloon here.  I don't think I have ever had a bad experience here.  The food is good, comes out hot and the service is great.  I guess if you figure in burger, fries and soda you will be about $10 per person, but it is worth it.

I am a fan of Red Robin's food....really.  I sometimes talk my kids into going because I am craving their fries or a burger.  :-) My favorite items on the menu are the Royal Red Robin burger and the Black and Blue burger.  YUM!!  They have an awesome Cobb Salad as well.  The drinks....well they have an awesome array of alcoholic drinks which helps.  :-) My only pet peeve is that the place is noisy as hell and there's always someone celebrating a birthday.  Which means that the staff sings that annoying song......uggghhhh They have Kids' Night on Tuesdays here in Parker, but they don't offer any kid specials like you would think.  They just have that bird mascot there, which is kind of creepy and the costume looks to be 20 years old!  It's in serious need of repair :-)  They also give kids balloons, which is not unlike any other night you would go.  They only difference is on Tuesdays, the noise level is double, so if the noise is too much on a normal night, then for sure avoid Tuesday night!

Long time patron, but have noticed a decline in recent years and huge price increase. We have young kids and they have requested we no longer go there after our latest visit, as it is so loud. We went on a Saturday night, so it is understandable that it was loud, the wait wasn't too bad, and the servers were courteous. My main complaint is that the lady next to our table accidently spilled her drink, only because the "NEW" tables were so awful and she went to set her drink down as she sat down. They are not level, small, have multiple sections, and not made for heavy use. Please consider getting your money back on those tables, horrible idea and my son walked out of there smelling like beer. Also, it took us tracking someone down to get it cleaned up, and the floor was still wet when we left. We were also astounded how the prices have gone up, for smaller portions. Like everywhere else though.

Have not eaten at a Red Robin in about twenty years.  Went with four other people to the Parker restaurant.  What good food!  Had a bacon burger...very tasty.  Wife had fish 'n chips (cod) cooked perfectly.  My son had a chicken wrap...again very tasty (I had to test drive a bit).  It will not be another twenty years I can promise!  Nice job Red Robin!

Came in For lunch and wanted a burger and a Strawberry Shake. Ordered the Bonzai Burger with a Tower of onion Rings.  Ordered my Burger Medium well. I love the flavor of the Teriyaki and the Pineapple/  It was moist and delicious.  Cant go wrong with Onion rings and Bottomless fries off your friends plate. The Strawberry shake had chunks of strawberries and was delicious.  The Customer Service never disappoints either and sitting where I can see a TV is a plus as well.

I'm a huge burger fan, but the Chicken sandwiches here are awesome! The BBQ one is the best though! Whiskey BBQ sauce, cheddar cheese, Onion Straws...very good! When you are in the mood for something lighter, just get it with the BBQ sauce, it is still really good. Service here is very...random. I was there with a party of 10, and we had 2 servers, and it was still awhile to get our orders taken, and drinks delivered. Stuff was coming out very slowly, and there were some people would were almost finished when the rest of the food came out. This is one time I wish tip wasn't included, as it was pretty poor service.

Well I have not been to Red Robin for a while a b d figured we would head over  for dinner we both ordered from the Genesis  and southern burgers.  They were ok but not at the price.  The burgers were supposed to be 8 oz but just did not seem that big.  They were both cooked pretty  well and my only issue  was the burgers were not hot  and  bit too heavy on sauces. The buns  both become   bit  soggy  a light toasting  might have helped.  Service was consistently slow.  We asked for an order  of fries to have before  our meal but the fries took so long we got the fries 10 seconds before our food arrived.  The fries  arrived hot and fresh.  But the fries with the burgers were not  really hot and fresh.   The burgers were warm but not hot it seemed as though our food sat around for a while and the fries even longer.  The burger themselves  were  ok but seemed small for an 8 oz burger.  Service was slow I had to wait quite a while  just for a tea refill.  We ordered  dessert the brownie  and lemonade  cake.  Both just needed to be plated.  It took more than 10 minutes to get the dessert.  The brownie  sticks were described as light but they were very old and heavy.  I Would Not Suggest Getting This Dessert unless you have a lot of vanilla  Ice cream.

We came here tonight around 5:45ish, waited about 35 minutes, and then sat down to eat. Service was prompt and attentive, waitress was really friendly, and the food was good. Only problem was my dad's burger. He got it and his party was okay, but the bun he received was REALLY dry! Like seriously, it was falling apart and looked rather stale. Other than that, food was good. The French fries were outstanding, warm and fresh every time. Apart from the nasty burger bun, nice experience.

Our good friend was in surgery at the hospital across the street and we knew it was going to be a long, stressful night. We took his wife and 18 month old son to Red Robin to grab a late night dinner. Even though it was about half an hour to closing time, we were greeted with a genuine smile and well taken care of.  The baby was kind of rambunctious and made a mess, but our server, Carmen made us feel at home and wouldn't accept any apologies. The food took a little longer than I had hoped to come out, but it was soooo good.  The manager checked on us, as well which is always appreciated. We left feeling much better and ready to face the long night. Thanks, Carmen!

Never been a fan of the food at Red Robin, but my kid loves it and on occasions like his birthday where he gets to choose where to go he always picks RR. They do have amazing, bottomless steak fries and ranch dipping sauce, but they're always real skimpy when you ask for a basket and with 3 people it doesn't last very long. And "bottomless" only works when your server comes by periodically. Which ours didn't. Someone - not our server - came by and finally took our drink order and maybe 15 minutes after we were seated our waitress finally came over. She took our order and we didn't see her at all for another 15-20 minutes. She kept disappearing somewhere in the back and appeared to not be helping out anybody. The burgers here are ho-hum if you get them without all the extra toppings they like to slather on, which is the way I like them. The meat is mostly flavorless without any extra pizzazz. I'm sure we'll be back the next time my kid gets to choose, but it certainly won't be by my choice!
It's a huge menu and it's almost completely burgers. The bottomless fries are terrible and have no flavor. If you love over priced burgers you will love with this place!

Went there on Friday with the family - will never return, told the wait would be 20 min, took 45 to get seated, food was cold, bottomless fries - sure if they would ever get them cooked in time to replace the cold fries that were initially sent out.  Manager was inattentive and did not appear to care.  Won't be back.

Great food and great service.  I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the 2 burgers that I tried.  They were both delicious.  We had the Banzai and the Black and Bleu.  The sweet potato fries were just ok.  The service was excellent for a party of 12.  The waitress always filled our drinks and our fries before they were empty.

Fantastic service clean atmosphere.  I'm not a big burger fan, but I've tried the mushroom Swiss burger its ok not my personal style.  If you aren't a burger fan I suggest the Whiskey river bbq chicken!  Amazing!!  I tried the reg fries they are yummy but the garlic parm have a bit too much salt for me.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin in forever my stomach must have remembered something my brain didn't and it led me into this place on a lazy Sunday evening.   The burgers and fries were definitely sub-par, nothing like I remembered.  And the place is one HUGE child day care center.  Screaming, kicking, snotty kids were eeeeeeverywhere.  Crikey.  It was all I could do to finish up quick, chug my beer and get the heck out of dodge. The only saving grace is that the servers and bartenders maintain a good attitude and upgrade your meal or fries when they can, as if to say "Yeah, I know..."  And they have later hours than most joints in Parker, so that's a plus.  But I can't say I'd recommend this place to a friend.

I always get an excellent burger or chicken sandwich here.  The fries are similarly top notch.  The addition of tasty sweet potato fries to the menu has been appreciated.  I have no doubt the friendly staff and attentive management would quickly fix any issues with my meal should it occur. Yes, the place is noisy and overrun by swarms of semi-feral children.  I would love it if they did not seat kids in the bar section unless the main  section was completely full. Top picks:  Banzai Burger, Chicken Caprese Sandwich, BLTA Croissant.
We come all the time, but sit in the Bar.  We dont have little kids. Love the Chocolate malt and Reds Tavern Double Cheeseburger!

Manager was extremely welcoming sat us in the bar. Our server on the other hand, was rude, unprofessional, and when I told her I was gluten intolerant... She felt the need to share with me her medical expertise. From my vanish point what I heard was "I don't believe in gluten allergies" which was ironic because she acknowledged peanut allergies as real. When I tried to explain the difference between intolerance/allergy and celiac she rolled her eyes at me. As a server myself I'm aware it takes more work to accommodate guests with allergies, however I also understand no one chooses to be plagued by allergies and therefore I am more willing to work a little harder for my guests in these situations. Perhaps red robin should educate their servers on allergies and better equip them to leave their presuppositions and attitudes at the door.

Arrived 5:30 on Thursday and was sat right away. Our server was just not interested. took our drinks orders after 5 min and then our food then disappeared. 30 min later he passed by to say he'd check on our order. Finally got food 40 min after ordering. Wife and I both had salads which were bland and unappealing. Our kids' meals were missing the sides and we never got the fries we asked for. It's expensive, slow and the staff seem overwhelmed.
We went to red robin to have a good meal with a kid friendly atmosphere . It was! The service was great the manager came over to check on us twice very impressive..

I don't like to give any place 5 stars, but last night was the best experience I've ever had at this Red Robin.  Our server, Shelby, was amazing.  It was as if she read our minds.  I've eaten here probably 50-100 times over the years and it is always good..just this time almost perfect.  My favorite is the Royal Burger.

We love red Robin. But this location has the worst service of any restaurant we have ever been to and it is not just one isolated incident. we have been here three times and all three times have been a terrible experience. They never have fries available (which is why we usually go to this restaurant) how can you not have fries available at red Robin??!!  service is slow and terrible we have never been satisfied at this restaurant. We love red robin in englewood- go there.

Talk about a sad story. Been going to RR for over 10 years. They have always gone up in price, lowered portions, customer service is non existent, and they don't clean their restaurant well. I swiped a napkin across my sticky table and it was black. I loved Red Robin - now I have some other places I prefer

I'm done with this location. The service is horrible. The last three times we have gone it has been forgotten food, cold food, forgotten drinks and nobody  checking on us after the food arrives. Today, to be specific, I was seated at a table for 10 minutes before anyone came by. Placed an order beers didn't arrive until well after our meal, and they were room temperature, had hardened foam on the sides, and my husbands tasted horribly sour. Nobody came to check, so we couldn't send them back. We ended up leaving the meal with a full beer on the table, with not a single person coming by at any point to offer him a new drink. Also, I had 5 fries on my plate with my burger. Getting more is a joke...they don't do it   husbands burger was gross, mine was cold. We went well after the lunch rush, so no reason for our server to be completely MIA..again. It's always this way. I worked for RR back in college and it is sad to their their quality standards drop so much because this management just doesn't seem to care. I encourage everyone to avoid this location. Make the drive to Park Meadows, or go to one of the burger places at Southlands just a couple exits up the 470.

I of course have been here many many times as my daughters friends have all at one time or another worked here!  The burgers are truly awesome along with the nachos' the endless fries and the chicken sandwiches.  This Parker location CAN get a little unruly with the bazillion rugrats running around, but then again it's a noisy place even with no kiddo's.  The latest trip was the same as usual, great food, great service, no wait and decent prices.

For a $10, "gourmet" burger, you'd think they'd have gourmet style buns.  Wendy's has better buns then here.  The burger is mediocre and I hate that I spent so much on one when I could've just gone to Good Times.
Kids hanging from the ceiling, climbing walls, crawling on the floor...sit at the bar area to avoid this catastrophe. You might actually be able to enjoy their delicious burgers, fries, and drinks.
